title: Newcastle boss Rafa Benitez calls for FA action for Wolves fans for abusing Jonjo Shelvey
text:
GETTY Jonjo Shelvey was banned for five games after racially abusing Wolves' star Romain Saiss 
Supporters chanted ‘You dirty racist b d’ at Shelvey during the leader’s win at Molineux. 
Shelvey was banned for five matches and fined £100,000 for racially abusing Wolves’ Morocco midfielder Romain Saiss the last time the clubs met in September. 
The ex- Liverpool midfielder was booed every time he touched the ball on Saturday, but the England man had the last laugh when he set up the 44th-minute winner for Aleksandar Mitrovic. 
Boss Benitez admitted he and Shelvey both knew what was coming and said: “One thing the FA has to maybe consider is what the fans were saying. “Maybe the FA should look at it, to control what the fans say and have more respect” Newcastle boss Rafa Benitez 
“Maybe the FA should look at it, to control what the fans say and have more respect.” 
Benitez was delighted with the way Shelvey handled the abuse though. 
“It was not an easy game for him but he did well,” he said. “He showed composure and a cool mind to play and keep the ball. He knows you have to concentrate on the game.” 
Benitez admitted he subbed matchwinner Mitrovic, 22, for Christian Atsu at half-time because he could have been sent off otherwise. The Serbia striker got away with a studs-up lunge on keeper Carl Ikeme when he had already been booked. 
“It was a risk,” said Benitez. “We could see the atmosphere was not ideal for him and we needed to be sure we were protecting him and the team.” 
Wolves boss Paul Lambert angrily confronted the Newcastle bench after the flashpoint between Mitrovic and Ikeme. 
“I was upset with one of their bench members,” said Lambert. 
“I’m not having anybody trying to come out and be derogatory to my bench and my staff, so I had a go back. Related articles
